proposed_strategy.name: Single Praśna Chunk
proposed_strategy.description: The entire provided content is the Second Praśna, which is small enough to constitute a single, complete chunk, respecting the character limit.

execution_plan.description: The entirety of the Second Praśna, including all Mantras (1 through 13) and the associated Prakashika commentary.

parsing_instructions.justification: The primary structural unit within the Praśna is the Mantra, which is clearly numbered and forms the unit immediately followed by its commentary.

start_pattern.description: A new Mantra (verse) begins with the verse number enclosed in double danda marks, following the core text.

end_pattern.description: The end of a Mantra unit (including its commentary) is marked by the start of the subsequent Mantra's core text, or by the chapter conclusion marker.
examples: **तस्मै स होवाच आकाशो ह वा एष देवो...

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: Treat the initial text (Grantha title, Praśna number, and section title [प्राणप्रशंसा]) as prefatory metadata before the first Mantra (।। १ ।।).
